intro: Spatularia vreelandii, commonly known as the spathularia, is a species of fungus that belongs to the family Sphingiaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a cup-like structure known as a basidiocarp. This fungus is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often on decaying wood or leaf litter. Its spores are dispersed through wind, contributing to its ecological role in nutrient cycling. Spatularia vreelandii is of interest to mycologists due to its distinct appearance and ecological significance.
